definition[0]: unhappy and worried because something unpleasant or disappointing has happened
example[0]: She was deeply upset about the way her father treated her.
example[1]: Debbie was upset that he didn’t spend more time with her.
example[2]: Miss Hurley is too upset to speak to anyone at the moment.
example[3]: She’s still deeply upset about her uncle’s death.
example[4]: He’s upset that he didn’t get an invitation to their wedding.
definition[1]: upset and shocked because someone has been unkind to you, especially someone that you trusted and thought was a friend
example[5]: Bill felt deeply hurt when he realized she had lied to him.
example[6]: Gretta was really hurt that none of her friends came to visit her in the hospital.
example[7]: Jackson was said to be ‘deeply hurt’ by the newspaper reports about him.
example[8]: He had a hurt expression on his face.
example[9]: Priests have been counselling distressed relatives of the victims.
example[10]: She was visibly distressed after hearing of her husband’s accident.
example[11]: Matilda was too distressed to speak.
definition[3]: so upset and worried that you are unable to do normal things, and nothing can make you feel calm
example[12]: Benson was so distraught over the breakup of his marriage that he felt like committing suicide.
example[13]: The distraught parents of the missing baby have made a public appeal for her return.
definition[4]: so upset that you cannot stop crying
example[14]: She called me one night in a terrible state, saying she wanted to die.
example[15]: I could see that she was in a bit of a state.
definition[5]: to be very upset or angry, so that you think things are worse than they really are
example[16]: I was too worked up to sleep.
example[17]: It’s not worth getting worked up about. Anyone can make a mistake.
definition[6]: to make someone feel unhappy or worried
example[18]: Don’t do anything that would upset him.
example[19]: It upsets me to see you cry.
definition[7]: to change a plan or situation in a way that causes problems
example[20]: The chemicals upset the balance of the environment.
definition[8]: to push something over without intending to
example[21]: He upset a bowl of soup.
definition[9]: to defeat an opponent who is considered to be much better than you
definition[10]: worry and unhappiness caused by an unexpected problem
example[23]: If you are the victim of a burglary, the emotional upset can affect you for a long time.
definition[11]: when a person or team defeats an opponent who is considered to be much better than them
example[24]: There was a major upset when the young skater took the gold medal.
